title.value: Relationship Between Arterial Stiffness Index, Pulse Pressure, and Magnetic Resonance Imaging Markers of White Matter Integrity: A UK Biobank Study
title.justification: The title is explicit about the scope and focus of the study, which involves assessing the relationship between arterial stiffness, pulse pressure, and MRI markers of white matter integrity using the UK Biobank data.
title.quote: Relationship Between Arterial Stiffness Index, Pulse Pressure, and Magnetic Resonance Imaging Markers of White Matter Integrity: A UK Biobank Study

extractions.description: The study investigates the relationship between arterial stiffness index (ASI), pulse pressure (PP), and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) markers for white matter integrity, utilizing data from the UK Biobank. The primary finding indicates that PP is a better predictor of white matter integrity compared to ASI for individuals aged 45-75 years. However, no significant relationship was found beyond age 75.

type.justification: The paper describes an empirical study which involves analyzing data from 17,984 participants from the UK Biobank to explore relationships between physiological and neuroimaging measures.
type.quote: Materials and Methods: 17,984 participants 63.09 Â± 7.31 from the UK Biobank were used for this study.

name.justification: The study is submitted to the 'Neurocognitive Aging and Behavior' section, focusing on aging-related neurocognitive processes and their physiological underpinnings.
name.quote: This article was submitted to Neurocognitive Aging and Behavior, a section of the journal Frontiers in Aging Neuroscience

name.justification: The paper uses MRI markers to assess white matter integrity, which is central to the study's methodology.
name.quote: ...relationship between arterial stiffness, pulse pressure, and magnetic resonance imaging markers of white matter integrity...

name.justification: The study examines arterial stiffness index (ASI) and pulse pressure (PP) as they relate to vascular aging, which impacts white matter integrity.
name.quote: ...arterial stiffness index (ASI) and peripheral PP with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) markers of white matter integrity.

name.justification: A significant portion of the study is dedicated to statistical analysis involving the vast dataset from the UK Biobank.
name.quote: Statistical Analysis: Prior to analysis, we tested the presence of outliers in each variable of interest...

name.justification: The study explicitly uses data from the UK Biobank as described in the Materials and Methods section.
name.quote: The data from the UK Biobank resource were used for the purpose of this study.

referenced_paper_title.value: UK Biobank: Protocol For a Large-Scale Prospective Epidemiological Resource
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper summarizes the design and protocol of the UK Biobank study which is the data source for the research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: UK Biobank study design and population had previously been detailed (Sudlow et al., 2015).
